text:
Hi! We’re looking to hire a full-time Content Marketer at <http://Albacross.com|Albacross.com> - a revenue acceleration platform that provides B2B companies with demand and sales intelligence. This role would be based ideally in Stockholm but we’re open to remote working too.

This person would own the content strategy and roadmap as well as write various long and short form content including thought leadership posts, product stories, sales enablement materials, website copy, social and emails posts. Working closely with the Head of Growth, design, development, sales and product teams, this is a great opportunity to work in a cross-functional environment and to make a big impact on the company as a whole. If this sounds interesting or you know someone who would be a good fit, please drop me a message!
 <https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/2299505869>

Working closely with the Head of Growth, design, development, sales and product teams, this is a great opportunity to work in a cross-functional environment and to make a big impact on the company as a whole. If this sounds interesting or you know someone who would be a good fit, please drop me a message!

text: I’ve had horrible experience applying for the same/similar position before, when I talked to Marcus Svensson, but I’m sure he’ll be able to tell you more about that :slightly_smiling_face: In fact,  it was the worst hiring experience I had in my career as a content marketer. Good luck!

text: I am, I applied for a content marketer role at Albacross about two years ago and I talked to the growth manager (Marcus) and the management (Viktor and others) as part of the hiring process. I was “hired” and signed the contract for the role, only to be turned down the day I was supposed to start working because “The CEO wasn’t convinced about my knowledge of SEO”. Essentially, I was ghosted by Albacross and Marcus Svensson ignored all of the messages that I sent him :slightly_smiling_face: I am sure that some things may have changed in the meantime, but I quit my job then to start working with Albacross and it was one of the biggest mistakes in my career

elements.text: I am, I applied for a content marketer role at Albacross about two years ago and I talked to the growth manager (Marcus) and the management (Viktor and others) as part of the hiring process. Essentially, I was ghosted by Albacross and Marcus Svensson ignored all of the messages that I sent him
I am sure that some things may have changed in the meantime, but I quit my job then to start working with Albacross and it was one of the biggest mistakes in my career

text: <@UJG9WTEKG> - A lot of us write content for dev audiences. For instance, I write for engineering leaders, and it's helpful to know that jobs like these exist. Also, I would say marketing and demand gen are content adjacent. I wonder what others' perspectives might be.
